name: Women's Competition Network
legal: none (the WCN does not have a legal status, it is an informal network of professionals)
bossPosition: Founder of WCN, partner at Sidley Austin LLP
memberOrga: Although there is no formal membership structure, attendance of WCN events is by invitation only and the network now connects over 1,800 women holding senior positions in corporate legal departments, law firms and chambers, consultancies, academic institutions, specialized media outlets, courts, and competition authorities around the world.
goal: Founded in 2008, the Women's Competition Network (WCN) is an international networking forum for senior competition law and policy professionals. It is the WCNâ€™s aim to provide a platform for high-level discussion of competition law and policy developments, to facilitate and strengthen networking among senior women competition professionals, and to mentor and promote the advancement of women in the field.
euInitiatives: The WCN is strictly a networking group and does not conduct any EU policy or lobbying activities, nor does it seek to influence the formation or implementation of policy or the decision-making processes of the EU institutions.
